meanings.definition: Food prepared to be eaten off the premises.
meanings.sent1: I love getting takeouts from the Chinese restaurant.
meanings.sent2: She ordered takeouts for dinner because she didn't feel like cooking.
meanings.sent3: The takeouts from the new pizza place were a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: His idea of a perfect night is watching movies with takeouts.
meanings.sent5: The smell of takeouts always makes me hungry.

meanings.definition: A section of a racecourse where horses are taken to warm up before a race.
meanings.sent1: The jockeys led the horses to the takeouts to prepare for the race.
meanings.sent2: The trainers watched closely as the horses trotted around the takeouts.
meanings.sent3: The horses seemed excited as they entered the takeouts area.
meanings.sent4: The takeouts were bustling with activity as the race time approached.
meanings.sent5: The takeouts provided a calm space for the horses before the race.

meanings.definition: A deduction or allowance, especially in horse racing.
meanings.sent1: The jockey was happy to hear about the takeouts for his horse.
meanings.sent2: The takeouts for the winning horse were calculated quickly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected takeouts made the race results even more thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The takeouts changed the odds and surprised many spectators.
meanings.sent5: The takeouts added an element of strategy to the horse racing event.
